bibl.title: Letter from Charles W. Coles to Philip Showalter Hench, January 30, 1942

div1.p: Coles informs Hench that he cannot find information about the Camp Lazear painting.

div1.head: Letter from Charles W. Coles to Philip Showalter Hench, January 30, 1942
div1.opener:
IN RE
CABLE ADDRESS “MUSEOLOGY NEW YORK”
THE AMERICAN MUSEUM OF NATURAL HISTORY
CENTRAL PARK WEST AT 79TH STREET
NEW YORK, N. Y.
January 30, 1942
DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION
CHARLES RUSSELL, PH.D., CURATOR
GRACE FISHER RAMSEY, PH.D., ASSOCIATE CURATOR
WILLIAM H. CARR, ASSISTANT CURATOR (OUTDOOR EDUCATION)
JOHN R. SAUNDERS, B.A., ASSISTANT CURATOR
HERMAN A. SIEVERS, STAFF ASSISTANT
FARIDA A. WILEY, STAFF ASSISTANT
WILLIAM LORD SMITH, M.D., STAFF ASSISTANT
GEORGINE MASTIN, STAFF ASSITANT
HAZEL L. MULLER, B.A., STAFF ASSISTANT
P. S. Hench, M.D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
With reference to your letter of January 27,
we have tried to find more information about the
painting of Camp Lazear. The most we could find was
an article about the painters life and in that was
nothing about the painting of Camp Lazear.

We are sorry we cannot get any further
information for you but trust that the little we did
find will be of help to you.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Charles H. Coles
Chief of Photo Division mp
